posts.author: Devlinor
posts.content:
Posting this here so I don't clog the main epic lvl section with it for now. I have this concept of a half orc Bard, with a high power song, lasting inspiration, and a barbarian with terrifying rage to really kick it in the butt. I came up with this on the CBC and thought to put it here to get feedback, and hints on how I can make this bad boy, even badder. Please note, I want to keep it workable for both solo and group, lasting inspiration and terrifying rage must be included, and I want the highest lvl bard song I can squeeze out of this half orc package. I am going for playable from 1-40 on most servers. I don't give a hang on PvP, not my cup of tea.

posts.author: shia luck
posts.content:
Hi, well seeing as we are in a new place I am going to try to be a bit more active in this guild.

I like the concept Dev, half orc casters and halfling tanks are always fun I think. *grin*

Some suggestions and things to think about

Starting stats:

str 16 (+ half orc 2 = 18) and Cha 14 (- half orc 2 =12) to start. Increase cha as you need to for spells. The str will help you more than CHA in the early stages and you'll need to be bard7 at a minimum b4 you need cha13.

Heavy armour & lvl split:

Get a level of a class with heavy armour proficiency. F5/Barb15/bard20 looks good to me. Epic weapon specilisation, grt rage x4 and terrifying and Lasting Inspiration can all be done with that, tho it would make LI a level later for the tumble dump. Alternatively, drop epic reflex for hvy armour proficiency (tho i think I would still adjust the lvls to bard25 for a better song. That would also get you a bard bonus feat at 23 which you could use for epic will, and then no need to lose your epic reflex if you really want it. I think there's better feats tho.)


Heavy armour & starting stats:

If you can get heavy armour, drop starting dex to 8 and use bard spells to boost it to 12.

Starting stats & casting:

I am a huge fan of expertise for any melee build, and for a casting one, having improved expertise available for while casting. I'd say it's well worth an extra, albeit expensive, point into intelligence (and is something to do with those points you saved from dex). Weapon Proficiency Exotic & toughness are easily dropped in terms of power (tho I guess your rp concept might require an exotic weapon), but if you get the ftr lvls you get more feats too soooooo.

Starting stats, skills and AC:

No tumble? That's -8AC! dex 8, INT 16 (-half orc2 = 14) and get tumble to 40!!


Have fun
